org.apparatus_templi.driver

Class ControllerModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apparatus_templi.driver.Driver
      • org.apparatus_templi.driver.ControllerModule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    public abstract class ControllerModule
extends Driver
    An abstract class for a driver that controls a remote module containing motors, switches, relays and the like. A driver extending this class would likely be paired with a remote module that expects to take commands, but will not otherwise act on its own.
    Author:
    Jonathan Nelson

    • Constructor Detail

      • ControllerModule

        public ControllerModule()

    • Method Detail

      • getControllerList

        public abstract ArrayList<String> getControllerList()
        Return a list of all controllers on the remote module. The driver is expected to keep track of which controllers are available on its corresponding remote module. The front ends will use this interface to get a list of what controllers are available.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of Strings of all known controllers on the remote module.

      • getControllerStatusXML

        public abstract String getControllerStatusXML(String controllerName)
        Returns an XML description of the current status of the requested controller.
        Parameters:
        controllerName - The name of the controller on the remote module.
        Returns:
        a String of XML data describing the current status of the controller. If the specified controller does not exist, then returns null.

      • tellController

        public abstract void tellController(String controllerName,
                  String command)
        Sends a command to a specific controller on the remote module. Called by the Coordinator on behalf of the front-ends. It is up to you do validate the incoming controllerName and command (if desired), and to reformat the command (if needed) before the message is sent.
        Parameters:
        controllerName - the String name of the controller on the remote module.
        command - the String command to send to the controller.
